caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while "Retr." indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while undeline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of different retrosynthesis models' performance using two evaluation protocols: year split and random split.  The "Int." column indicates whether the model considers interactions between constituent elements, and "Retr." shows if the model uses retrieved reference materials.  Performance is measured by top-K accuracy and recall (both macro and micro).  The table helps to assess the impact of including element interactions and reference material retrieval on model accuracy.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while "Retr." indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while undeline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of various models on inorganic retrosynthesis planning. The models are evaluated based on their ability to predict precursor sets for inorganic materials.  The performance is measured using Top-K accuracy and recall, with both macro and micro averages. The table is split into year split and random split sections.  The "Int." column indicates whether the model considers interactions between elements. The "Retr." column indicates whether the model uses retrieved reference materials.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while "Retr." indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while undeline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of different models in inorganic retrosynthesis planning, considering two splitting methods (Year split and Random split) and two factors affecting the model's performance (Incorporating interactions among constituent elements and Retrieving reference materials).  The performance metrics include Top-K accuracy and recall, both calculated using macro and micro averaging methods, for top 1, 3, 5, and 10 predictions. This allows assessing the impact of incorporating interactions between elements and the effectiveness of retrieving relevant reference materials.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while "Retr." indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while undeline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of various models in inorganic retrosynthesis planning, categorized by their ability to consider interactions between elements and whether they retrieve reference materials.  The results are shown for two different data splits (year split and random split) and include top-K accuracy and recall metrics (macro and micro).  The table helps to highlight the impact of key model features on performance.

caption: Table 4: Qualitative Analysis ( Target Material: Pb9[Li2(P2O7)2(P4O13)2] )
description: This table presents a qualitative analysis of the proposed method's performance in retrosynthesis planning for the target material Pb9[Li2(P2O7)2(P4O13)2]. It compares the results of using only the MPC retriever versus using both the MPC and NRE retrievers. The table shows that using both retrievers leads to a successful prediction of the complete precursor set, whereas using only the MPC retriever results in an incomplete prediction.  This highlights the complementary nature of the two retrievers and the importance of incorporating thermodynamic information (from the NRE retriever) for accurate precursor prediction.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while "Retr." indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while undeline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of Retrieval-Retro and several baseline methods on two different data splits: year split and random split.  The results are shown for different top-K accuracy metrics (Top-1, Top-3, Top-5, Top-10), macro and micro recall, along with indicators showing whether the model considers interactions between constituent elements and whether it retrieves reference materials.  The table helps to illustrate the effectiveness of Retrieval-Retro's key components and its overall superiority compared to existing methods.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while “Retr.” indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while underline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of different inorganic retrosynthesis models.  It shows the top-k accuracy and recall for each model across two different data splits (year split and random split).  The models are categorized based on whether they consider interactions among constituent elements and whether they retrieve reference materials.  The results allow for a comparison of models with different features and data usage strategies.

caption: Table 7: Formation energy predictor performance on experimental formation energy data.
description: This table shows the mean absolute error (MAE) in eV/atom achieved by a model trained only on experimental data (Ablation) and a model pre-trained on DFT data and fine-tuned on experimental data (Ours).  The results demonstrate that pre-training on DFT data improves the model's performance on experimental data.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while “Retr.” indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while underline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of different models in inorganic retrosynthesis planning, categorized by year split and random split.  Key metrics include Top-K Accuracy and Recall (macro and micro).  It also shows whether the models considered interactions among elements and used reference material retrieval, providing a comprehensive evaluation of different model designs and approaches.

caption: Table 9: Training and inference time per epoch (sec/epoch).
description: This table presents the training and inference time per epoch for various models used in the inorganic retrosythesis planning experiments. It compares the training and inference times of Retrieval-Retro against several baseline methods.  The "Retriever" column indicates whether the model employs a reference material retriever.  The table shows that models using retrievers generally have longer training times than those without retrievers.  However, the training time for Retrieval-Retro is still manageable.  Roost and CrabNet have significantly longer training times compared to the other methods.

caption: Table 1: Overall model performance in (a) Year split and (b) Random split. “Int.” denotes whether the model accounts for interactions among constituent elements, while "Retr." indicates whether the model retrieves reference materials. Bold indicates the best performance, while undeline represents the second best performance.
description: This table presents a comparison of the performance of different retrosynthesis models in two experimental settings: year split and random split.  It shows Top-K accuracy and recall metrics for each model, indicating its ability to predict the correct precursor set for inorganic materials. The "Int." column specifies if the model considers interactions among elements, while the "Retr." column shows if the model uses retrieved reference materials.  The table highlights which models perform best overall and whether incorporating element interactions and retrieved materials leads to improved accuracy and recall.
